title: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk in critical condition after being shot at Utah college event
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Charlie Kirk, 31, was shot and killed during a Turning Point USA event at Utah Valley University on September 10, 2025.
A suspect was not immediately identified or detained, according to sources familiar with the investigation in Orem, Utah.
The shooting at Kirk's event occurred amid rising political violence, drawing reactions from both Republican and Democratic figures.

title: Patriots’ defensive coordinator Terrell Williams will be away from team for a few days
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots coordinator Terrell Williams to miss several days due to an unforeseen health issue, announced coach Mike Vrabel.
Inside linebackers coach Zak Kuhr may assume roles during Williams's absence, decision pending for the game against the Dolphins.
Vrabel, former Texans defensive coordinator, might call defensive plays Sunday if needed as Williams focuses on health recovery.

title: 8 unforgettable fall destinations in Vermont, according to Boston.com readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Franklin County's rail trails offer scenic biking and hiking options, with Lamoille Valley and Missisquoi Valley trails highlighted.
Stowe is highly recommended for experiencing peak fall foliage, with attractions like Ben & Jerry's Factory in nearby Waterbury.
Lake Champlain praised for its rental cabins and proximity to the Canadian border, noted for antique shopping and farms.

title: Readers: Are cider doughnuts ever bad?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Cider doughnuts are a staple fall treat in New England, praised for their airy texture and balanced sweetness.
Boston.com readers named Bolton Spring Farm, Carver Hill Orchard, and Smolak Farms as top cider doughnut spots.
Feedback is requested on whether cider doughnuts can ever be unsatisfactory, with responses potentially featured in future articles.

title: Review & setlist: Dua Lipa ramps up the energy, and the electricity, at TD Garden
author: Annie Jonas and Kelly Chan
bullets: Dua Lipa energized TD Garden with her 'Radical Optimism Tour', showcasing new material from her 2024 album.
Fans from around the world attended, highlighted by Lipa's interactions and a cover of Aerosmith's 'I Don't Want to Miss a Thing'.
Stage design featured dynamic visuals, blending oceanic themes with choreography, despite some disjointed visual elements.

title: How to buy World Cup tickets for Gillette Stadium
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Gillette Stadium will host seven 2026 World Cup games, including five group matches and two knockout rounds.
Ticket sales involve multiple phases, starting with Visa Presale Draw; tickets range from $60 to $6,730.
FIFA expects high demand, with a dedicated resale platform for fans unable to attend after purchasing tickets.

title: Greg Olsen spoke about getting replaced by Tom Brady
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Greg Olsen expressed disappointment over being replaced by Tom Brady as Fox Sports lead color commentator.
Olsen stated that media portrayal implied animosity with Brady, which he denies, wanting Brady to succeed.
Brady, facing pressure to excel, received criticism for an uneven performance during last year's Super Bowl commentary.

title: Boston police release photos in late-night cellphone thefts investigation
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police released photos to identify suspects in cellphone thefts outside city nightclubs and bars.
Suspects allegedly stole phones during rideshares, using threats or deception to access victims' personal information.
Thefts reported in Fenway, Back Bay, Downtown, and Seaport occurred mostly between 11:30 p.m. and 2 a.m.

title: NBA passes new ‘heave’ rule that Payton Pritchard will love
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: NBA implements rule not counting missed end-of-period halfcourt heaves towards individual shooting percentages starting in 2025-26 season.
A 'heave' is a shot from beyond 36 feet in final three seconds of a quarter; misses now count towards team stats.
Celtics' Payton Pritchard has been an advocate, hitting notable heaves, including a 49-foot buzzer-beater in 2024 NBA Finals.

title: Watch Matt Damon and Ben Affleck in the first trailer for Netflix’s cop thriller ‘The Rip’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck star as Miami cops in the Netflix thriller 'The Rip', set to stream January 16.
The film follows police finding a large stash of dirty money and the ensuing trust issues, directed by Joe Carnahan.
The cast also includes Steven Yeun, Teyana Taylor, and Kyle Chandler, with production by Damon and Affleck's Artists Equity.
